info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued May 2 at 11:30PM CDT by NWS New Orleans LA
info.description:
At 1128 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms capable of producing funnel clouds along a line extending from near Long Beach to near Biloxi to near Gulf Park Estates. Movement was northeast at 25 mph.
HAZARD...Funnel clouds, winds in excess of 40 mph, and half inch hail.
SOURCE...Radar indicated.
IMPACT...If a funnel cloud briefly touches down, minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects.
Locations impacted include... Gulfport, Latimer, Big Point, Lyman, D'iberville, St. Martin, Escatawpa, Gulf Hills, Vancleave, Gautier, Gulf Park Estates, Ocean Springs, Hickory Hills, Biloxi, and Saucier.
This includes the following Interstates... Interstate 10 in Mississippi between mile markers 26 and 66. Interstate 110 in Mississippi between mile markers 3 and 4.
info.instruction:
If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.
Conditions are favorable for the development of weak, brief funnel clouds. This type of funnel cloud is harmless, but on rare occasions they can briefly touch down, producing wind gusts over 50 mph. If a funnel cloud is spotted move indoors or to safe harbor and report your sighting to the National Weather Service.

parameter.value: STRONG THUNDERSTORMS WILL IMPACT PORTIONS OF CENTRAL HARRISON AND SOUTHERN JACKSON COUNTIES THROUGH 1215 AM CDT

area.areaDesc: Northern Harrison; Northern Jackson; Southern Harrison; Southern Jackson
